I am happy to recommend this game, though I have to admit it's best to purchase the sequel instead. Why? Because currently it is priced around the same level and the sequel has all the campaigns from the previous game included! This means more than a dozen levels with continuous zombie shooting!

In any case, this, just like its sequel, is an excellent game. Although it was released more than 5 years ago I believe it aged well - the game still looks good thanks to the well-developed Source Engine. Years later Valve released many updated including DLCs that expand upon the campaigns - the latest, The Sacrifice, came out in 2010.

Left 4 Dead is a great game! It is a coop-based, action-oriented survival horror game. It is pure fun to get rid of the continuous hordes of zombies with friends game after game! A highly recommended game and not just for the fans of the genre!

If you can find this particularly cheap it's kind of a decent alternative to Left 4 Dead 2. There are no melee weapons, which I've come to find annoying because of the people who tend to use them (weaving in and out of my line of fire), and the most annoying special infected are gone - jockeys, spitters and chargers. Shotguns are also a lot better in this version. They seem to have a tad more kick and have way more ammo. That said, it was maybe a good thing they were nerfed; I don't know.

Another thing I like is the graphical style. It's moodier, darker and more atmospheric than in the sequel.

There are no bile jars or defibs/chest paddles. Make of that what you will. I'm not entirely too fussed they aren't here - especially not the bile jars. Pipe bombs are good enough for me.

However, there are some definite downsides to this version of the game. There are fewer campaigns availible (L4D2 has all the campaigns included in this game as well as its own original ones) - there's basically half as many iirc - and there are fewer game modes.

So this is a great game on its own, but both this and Left 4 Dead 2 cost the same and the latter is pretty much superior. But if you like Left 4 Dead 2 a lot and can get this version cheap I'd say go for it.

Warto zacząć od jedynki, gdyż dwójka jest zdecydowanie lepsza. Czasami brakowało mi miejscami amunicji do broni maszynowej, ale i tak świetnie się bawiłem. Widzę, że na serwerach pustkich w przeciwieństwie do sequela. Szkoda tylko, że jest mało rodzajów broni.
You can't beat the classics.

Left 4 Dead является одним из лучших кооперативных шутеров, в которые мне доводилось когда-либо играть. Отличная атмосфера в сеттинге зомбиапокалипсиса, которая приправлена лёгким юмором и отличными игровыми персонажами. Игра настолько популярна, что о ней просто невозможно рассказать что-то новое. Кроме того, Left 4 Dead обладает отличным режимом сражения и выживания, где первый даёт ещё огромное количество времени проведённого в игре. Русскоязычных игроков настолько много, что они попадаются почти в каждой игре, так что для нашего отечественного игрока нет поводов для беспокойств. По атмосфере эта игра затыкает Left 4 Dead 2 за пояс, хотя это довольно субъективное мнение, поскольку у второй части есть ряд своих преимуществ. Рекомендую к приобретению.

I know that by purchasing Left 4 Dead 2, you get all of what's in this game as well but playing the maps and characters just seems wrong. Personally, I feel L4D1 is more of a true horror zombie game than L4D2 will ever be. In my opinion, the zombie models are scarier here (you won't see these better models in the L4D2 version of these maps), the atmosphere is amazing, and the characters just go more in to detail. 

Even today, I sometimes find myself playing L4D1 while I see my friends play L4D2 and that just brings me to conclude that L4D1 is the better game and is the horror that I would recommend to anybody who takes an interest in this franchise. To me, Valve completely messed up their new L4D2 maps as the characters weren't fitting at all for a zombie apoloclpyse nor did they take it seriously. The new special infected in L4D2 were a complete joke (I mean, seriously.....a man humping monkey...) and the atmosphere made the game seem terrible in terms of horror. I swear....when I first got L4D1, I pissed my pants (Literally) in 2008 when I played No Mercy as I got pounced by a guy in a hoodie for the first time. When I played L4D2, I had some fun moments but it never seemed as holy and great as Left 4 Dead 1 was in my heart.

TL;DR: 
Get Left 4 Dead 2 if you're just looking to play with others online and want a more fun and less scary experience...
Get Left 4 Dead 1 if you're the type of man who isn't afraid of the night skies and the zombies that lurk your very existence

I bought this game as part of the Summer sale (yeah, I know, a million years after everyone else.) my only previous experience with it was a friend brought it over on the Xbox once, I didn't do too well then either. Upon buying it, perhaps unwisely I jumped straight into a multiplayer campaign, to my (pleasent) surprise, I had a blast, the controls are well designed to the point where a tutorial is almost completely unnecessary, the atmosphere is extremely effective (to the point that whenever I was firing an assault rifle for any length of time I found myself almost involuntarily screaming "SUPPRESSING FIIIIRE!" until I was done or out of ammo. and the great thing about getting into this game late is, lots of people still play it, odds are you will end up on a team with far more experienced people, and as long as you can avoid accidentally shooting them (six times on the first level) you won't feel like you're slowing them down and, hopefully you'll get into the swing of things as I did and feel a valuable member of the team before the campaign is over.

All in all, very fun game, there is definitely a reason that this still costs more than some other, more recent shooters I've seen

This game was a great game. I'm reviewing this game in 2014 and I haven't played it competitively for a few years now. To me, this game excels best at the competitive level, much like CS:GO, in which teamwork is mandatory as well as individual skill. The L4D Versus mode was the mode I loved most. Just being able to coordinate with my fellow infected members via voice chat to pounce onto the survivors in a timely manner was such an exciting event. Sadly, the community is quite scarce in this game in 2014 so there is no real going back without playing the same people over and over. Single player, on the other hand, is still very much viable. I remember single player being fun at first, but once you master the mechanics of the game single player becomes quite easy on the hardest difficulty. Still, I've dished over 1000+ hours into this game so I can't help but say, this is a great game! Thumbs up! :D

Was kann man zu Left 4 Dead sagen?

Fangen wir mal von vorne an.

In Left 4 Dead geht es um 4 Kameraden namens Francis, Bill, Lois und Zoey.
Diese versuchen halt im Kampf gegen die Infizierten zu überleben.

Kommen wir nun zum Spiel selbst.

Wer spaß daran hat mit seinen Freunden Zombies zu metzeln oder den Zombiemodus bei Call of Duty mag
wir mit Left 4 Dead nichts falsch machen.

Jeder Spielmodus macht spaß und manchmal kann man sich sogar erschrecken!

Ich hoffe euch hat die Review geholfen,
und jetzt viel spaß beim metzeln! :)

I am happy to [b]Recommend[/b] this game that i been playing for over [u]10.0 years[/u] now as of [b]09-21-2019.[/b]

I'm at 3,335.0 hrs on record as of [b]09-21-2019[/b] and i still love it.

Left for dead 1 / Left for dead 2 are not better than each other what it comes down too is what one you love more because of that, I recommend you buy both and see which one you [u]Truely will love[/u] and you should spend at least [u]1K+ hours in Each[/u] before you [u]Judge[/u] them
(at least 250+ hours in single player mode & 500+ hours in VS Mode & 250+ Hours in Others) 
You should spend these hours in-game with good friends not just idle it / playing with bad teammates.
You will learn that in the end both games are great to play with others, with that said its a good idea to make some good friends to play with and join them when playing both games.

Classic 4 Player Co-Op Zombie Survival! Left 4 Dead is an instant gaming classic. It may not be one of the best horror based games in the genre but it's all about fun. The reason why it's not scary is because the common infected isn't really interested in eating you like a traditional zombie would. Instead, they want to beat the living HELL out of you until you die. They're not HUNGRY zombies but rather ANGRY zombies.

The mechanics are awesome, A.I. can be difficult and challenging when set, graphics are amazing, and the controls are well done. You can't beat this game because it's too much fun.
